item.title: Adrienne's Pizza Bar
item.description: Was ok. Nothing too memorable. Got the pizza with proscuitto on top. I think they should’ve cut it into smaller pieces.

item.title: Bonchon
item.description: Pretty bad and expensive. 10 pieces of bites fro $14, and it doesn’t even come with a drink.

item.title: Berimbau Do Brasil
item.description: The feijoada was pretty good. The picanha was interesting in that it was super soft. Not quite what I was expecting.

item.title: Brooklyn Banh Mi
item.description: Best banh mi I’ve had so far in New York. Cheap too. But this place is CLOSED.

item.title: CoBa
item.description: Their pho + banhmi combo $12.50 is OK for lunch.

item.title: Blanca
item.description: Really good. Definitely get the drink pairing. Michelin 2 star. $300 per person including drinks.

item.title: Jungsik
item.description: This place was really really good. Korean Michelin 2 star and well worth it. Probably one of the best Michelin star restaurants I’ve been to in NYC.

item.title: Blue Hill
item.description: Place is pretty good but veggie centric. Pretty much farm to table kind of foods.

item.title: Delaware and Hudson
item.description: 2016 and 2017 Michelin 1 star. Tasting only for dinner. Atlantic food. Fantastic.

item.title: Gallagher's Steakhouse
item.description: The cream of spinach tastes like Lawry’s. The horseradish cream was good. The prime rib not as good as Keen’s.

item.title: Delmonico
item.description: Got the Delmonico steak. I like the char on this, but the steak kindi of sucked because it wasn’t flavorful nor fatty. Cream of spinach was just OK.

item.title: Ikinari
item.description: Got the rare strip. It was pretty good for $30 for 14 oz. Not a lot of fat on it. I think the price keeps getting cheaper because not a lot of people go to this.

item.title: Chuck and Blade
item.description: New York strip was so so. Cream of spinach was not good. There were lots of tendons in the meat. The lava cake dessert was good though.

item.title: Quality Eats
item.description: Skirt steak was pretty good. Very affordable. Good date spot I think.

item.title: Strip House
item.description: Steak was just OK. Service was slow as hell. Truffle cream of spinach was good.

item.title: American Cut
item.description: Decent for the price. This is Marc Forgione’s steak house.

item.title: 212 Steakhouse
item.description: Ok, this place is the only legit place in NYC that has real kobe certified beef from Japan. It was delicious and cheap… with the groupon.

item.title: Peter Lugers
item.description: This place is overrated. The steak isn’t that tender. There are a bunch of copy cat places like Wolfgang that are comparable. In addition, when I went, this place was cash only.

item.title: Keens
item.description: Best prime rib I have ever had. They are known for their mutton chops though, but damn… this prime rib is that good!

item.title: Old Homestead
item.description: Got the aged rib eye for 2. Was surprisingly good. It’s not the best steakhouse in New York, but it’s not bad at all.

item.title: Thai Sliders
item.description: Good tom yum noodle soup for lunch. Actually pretty good overall pad thai and pad see ew staples.

item.title: Casa Mono
item.description: Stumbled into here while drunk. I recall it was pretty good, but I don’t remember what was ordered. Had no idea this had Michelin stars either. When I walked in, it was all empty.

item.title: Cafe Riazor
item.description: Spanish stuff. Cheap decent lunch.

item.title: Grand Central Oyster Bar
item.description: Pretty decent. Worth this 1 time trip and that’s about it. The oyster pan roast was alright. The soft shell crab was pretty decent too. I think I’d get the clam chowder over the oyster pan roast.

item.title: Simply Hooked
item.description: This used to be in the Lower East Side, but I guess they set up shop in this Gansevoort Market area. It wasn’t that good. I prefer the A Salt & Battery place instead.
